description: Rhinoceroses are large herbivorous mammals with one or two horns on their snouts, native to Africa and Asia.
They graze or browse depending on species and are threatened by poaching.
Rabbits are small herbivorous mammals with long ears and strong hind legs, prolific breeders in many regions.
They feed on grasses, herbs and vegetables.
Raccoons are adaptable omnivorous mammals with dexterous forepaws and masked facial markings, common in urban and wild areas.
They eat a varied diet including fruits, invertebrates and human food waste.
Redstarts are small passerine birds with colourful tails often found in woodlands and gardens.
They feed on invertebrates and sometimes small fruits.
Ravens are large intelligent corvids known for adaptability, problem solving and vocal complexity.
They are omnivorous and occupy diverse habitats from coasts to mountains.
